column1: Child and Adolescent Mental Health MSc
column3: UCL Great Ormond Street Institute of Child Health
column5: Register your interest in graduate study at UCLThis multidisciplinary programme is delivered through a blend of clinical and research expertise with a focus on delivering high standards of clinical care. You will be encouraged to apply your critical and analytical thinking skills to theory, policy and practice in child and adolescent mental health.Through the programme, you will gain clinical, professional, academic and research skills in child and adolescent mental health and their application to underpin clinical practice.In addition, you will gain skills in analysing principles of policy, planning and management in child and adolescent mental health and you will increase your understanding of the impact of culture and diversity on clinical theory and practice.
column9: 1 year full time, 2 years part time, 5 years flexible
